questions.text: Which statement best describes Application Lifecycle Management (ALM)?
options: A document repository for storing project files
A coding guideline for agile teams only
A standalone QA methodology without design or deployment
A strategic process managing a product from idea through design, development, testing, deployment, and end of life

questions.text: Which is NOT listed as a key benefit of ALM in the guide?
Which example in the guide illustrates why ALM coordination is critical?
options: Modern products like automobiles include software with very large codebases requiring multi‑team coordination
ALM only matters for mobile apps, not embedded systems
Standalone spreadsheets are sufficient for all collaboration
Simple single‑file scripts are easier to rewrite

questions.text: What does Codebeamer primarily provide within the ALM context?
options: A general purpose email client for teams
End‑to‑end traceability and a collaborative platform with role‑based access
A low‑code UI builder for consumer apps

questions.text: Which functional areas are highlighted in Codebeamer’s lifecycle ‘orchestra’?
options: Payroll, taxation, HR onboarding, expense management
Requirements management, test management, release management, analytics, and dashboards
Printer queues, file compression, desktop theming
Static website hosting, image editing, social media posting

questions.text: In Codebeamer, what are trackers most closely compared to?
options: Tables in a relational database that define fields and relationships

questions.text: Which items appear as ‘rows’ within a tracker?
options: Tracker items representing individual records (e.g., requirements, tasks)

questions.text: What is true about parent/child hierarchy among tracker items?
options: It automatically sets permissions for child items
It aids readability but does not create logical dependencies
It blocks downstream references from being created
It enforces execution order across tasks

questions.text: Which default trackers are commonly present in a blank project?
options: Customer Requirements, System Requirements, Tasks, Bugs, Test Runs, Releases, Test Sets, Test Cases, Test Configurations
Marketing Campaigns, Ads, Leads, CTR Reports
Device Drivers, Kernel Modules, OS Logs

questions.text: What do references represent in tracker hierarchy diagrams?
options: Upstream/downstream links between items across trackers

questions.text: Which direction do arrows point in Codebeamer’s Configuration Diagram?
What do state transitions define for tracker items?
options: Allowed status changes through the item’s lifecycle

questions.text: In the Customer Requirement Specifications workflow, what can happen to an Accepted item per configuration?
options: It auto‑locks and cannot change state
It must jump directly to Completed
It may be rolled back to Draft before moving to Rejected

questions.text: Which view shows a three‑pane layout for tracker content?
options: Document view with tracker tree, item list, and properties pane
Histogram view with stacked bars and lines

questions.text: Which view displays items as rows and attributes as columns?
Which view organizes work by status and can be grouped by assignee?
Which additional views are highlighted?
options: Document edit view, Traceability report, Test coverage browser
Remote desktop, FTP client, SSH terminal
Theme editor, Icon picker, Palette manager
CPU monitor, Memory profiler, Disk defragmenter

questions.text: Which statement best defines a Test Configuration?
options: A documented product condition under which a test is executed
A list of unrelated bug IDs

questions.text: What is a Test Case comprised of?
options: Detailed procedure with descriptions, pre‑actions, steps, and post‑actions

questions.text: How is a Test Run described?
options: Daily build of the source code
Execution of a test case using one release and one configuration

questions.text: What does a Test Set represent?
options: A set of operating system users
A logical group of related test cases with allowed releases/configurations

questions.text: What integration is emphasized for test management?
options: Integration with requirements, tasks, bugs, and source to ensure traceability

questions.text: What does cbQL stand for in Codebeamer?
options: Codebeamer Query Language used to build sophisticated reports

questions.text: Which capabilities are listed under Data Visualization and Reporting?
options: Paint icons, crop images, and animate banners
Provision servers, compile kernels, and flash firmware
Encrypt emails, compress files, and stream music
Filter tracker items, generate reports, and create wiki pages

questions.text: What are Data Visualization Widgets used for?
options: Displaying data from reports on dashboards (with 20+ widgets available)

questions.text: Which views allow export to Microsoft Office per the guide?
Which challenge did Navya face before adopting Codebeamer?
options: Hardware shortages in test labs only
Excessive reliance on a single integrated ALM tool
Traceability and visibility issues due to a mix of disparate tools (Git, spreadsheets, Jira)
Too many CAD assemblies in a single file

questions.text: What did Codebeamer provide as a solution for Navya’s teams?
options: An AR headset for virtual meetings
A new email server for notifications
End‑to‑end view of development with standardized policies and traceability

questions.text: What outcome is described when a test on anti‑collision software fails?
options: A bug is recorded and the Scrum Master can reprioritize tasks linked to safety requirements
The entire release is canceled automatically

questions.text: Why do industry project templates matter?
options: They replace all trackers with spreadsheets
They accelerate setup with built‑in artifacts, logic, and best practices

questions.text: Which deliverables commonly align with Agile concepts in the ALM framework?
options: Device drivers, OS kernels, firmware, bootloaders
Epics (customer requirements), user stories (system requirements), tasks (sprints), and test runs

questions.text: What does the Library enable in requirements management?
options: Storage of binary build artifacts only
Reuse of tracker items across projects and trackers

questions.text: What does a tracker’s ‘Permissions’ configuration control?
options: Who can view and act on items and transitions

questions.text: Which components make up the Document view layout?
options: Left pane (tracker tree), middle pane (items), right pane (properties)

questions.text: Which tracker type includes start/end date fields as shown?
options: Bug trackers include sprint dates only
Requirement trackers include end dates; tasks never have dates
Release trackers include only version strings
Task trackers include start and end dates; requirement trackers do not

questions.text: What’s the purpose of Workflow Diagrams for trackers?
options: To visualize allowed status transitions and possible rollbacks

questions.text: Which dashboard widget lists recent actions and who performed them?
Which aspect of Codebeamer ensures traceability across lifecycle #38?
options: References and linked artifacts between requirements, tasks, tests, and bugs
